pli-tv-kd9:0.4.eng: 1. The account of the monk Kassapagotta

pli-tv-kd9:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā campāyaṃ viharati gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre.
pli-tv-kd9:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Campā on the banks of the Gaggarā lotus pond.

pli-tv-kd9:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena kāsīsu janapade vāsabhagāmo nāma hoti.
pli-tv-kd9:1.1.2.eng: At that time in the country of Kāsi there was a village called Vāsabha

pli-tv-kd9:1.1.3.pli: Tattha kassapagotto nāma bhikkhu āvāsiko hoti tantibaddho ussukkaṃ āpanno—
pli-tv-kd9:1.1.3.eng: with a resident monk called Kassapagotta. He was dedicated to the local monastery,
pli-tv-kd9:1.1.3.comm: Sp 3.380: Tantibaddhoti tasmiṁ āvāse kattabbatātantipaṭibaddho, “Tantibaddho: bound to what is to be done in regard to that monastery”.

pli-tv-kd9:1.1.4.pli: “kinti anāgatā ca pesalā bhikkhū āgaccheyyuṃ, āgatā ca pesalā bhikkhū phāsu vihareyyuṃ, ayañca āvāso vuddhiṃ viruḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjeyyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd9:1.1.4.eng: trying to get good monks to come, to help those who had come be comfortable, and to make the local monastery grow and reach maturity.

pli-tv-kd9:1.1.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū kāsīsu cārikaṃ caramānā yena vāsabhagāmo tadavasaruṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:1.1.5.eng: At this time a number of monks who were wandering in Kāsi arrived at Vāsabha.

pli-tv-kd9:1.1.6.pli: Addasā kho kassapagotto bhikkhu te bhikkhū dūratova āgacchante, disvāna āsanaṃ paññapesi, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipi, paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahesi, pānīyena āpucchi, nahāne ussukkaṃ akāsi, ussukkampi akāsi yāguyā khādanīye bhattasmiṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:1.1.6.eng: When Kassapagotta saw those monks coming, he prepared seats, and he set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet. He then went out to meet them, received their bowls and robes, and asked if they wanted water to drink. He made sure they had a bath, and he helped them get congee, fresh foods, and meals.

pli-tv-kd9:1.1.7.pli: Atha kho tesaṃ āgantukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd9:1.1.8.pli: “bhaddako kho ayaṃ, āvuso, āvāsiko bhikkhu nahāne ussukkaṃ karoti, ussukkampi karoti yāguyā khādanīye bhattasmiṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:1.1.8.eng: “He’s great, this resident monk, since he helps us with all these things.

pli-tv-kd9:1.1.9.pli: Handa mayaṃ, āvuso, idheva vāsabhagāme nivāsaṃ kappemā”ti.
pli-tv-kd9:1.1.9.eng: Let’s settle down right here in Vāsabha.”

pli-tv-kd9:1.1.10.pli: Atha kho te āgantukā bhikkhū tattheva vāsabhagāme nivāsaṃ kappesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd9:1.2.2.pli: “yo kho imesaṃ āgantukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ āgantukakilamatho so paṭippassaddho.
pli-tv-kd9:1.2.2.eng: “These monks are now rid of their tiredness from traveling.

pli-tv-kd9:1.2.3.pli: Yepime gocare appakataññuno tedānime gocare pakataññuno.
pli-tv-kd9:1.2.3.eng: And by now they know where to get alms.

pli-tv-kd9:1.2.4.pli: Dukkaraṃ kho pana parakulesu yāvajīvaṃ ussukkaṃ kātuṃ, viññatti ca manussānaṃ amanāpā.
pli-tv-kd9:1.2.4.eng: Also, in the long run it’s hard work to seek support from unrelated folk, and people don’t like to be asked.

pli-tv-kd9:1.2.5.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ na ussukkaṃ kareyyaṃ yāguyā khādanīye bhattasmin”ti.
pli-tv-kd9:1.2.5.eng: Why don’t I stop helping them get congee, fresh foods, and meals?”

pli-tv-kd9:1.2.6.pli: So na ussukkaṃ akāsi yāguyā khādanīye bhattasmiṃ.

pli-tv-kd9:1.2.7.pli: Atha kho tesaṃ āgantukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd9:1.2.8.pli: “pubbe khvāyaṃ, āvuso, āvāsiko bhikkhu nahāne ussukkaṃ akāsi, ussukkampi akāsi yāguyā khādanīye bhattasmiṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:1.2.8.eng: “Previously this resident monk made sure we got a bath, and he helped us get congee, fresh foods, and meals.

pli-tv-kd9:1.2.9.pli: Sodānāyaṃ na ussukkaṃ karoti yāguyā khādanīye bhattasmiṃ.

pli-tv-kd9:1.2.10.eng: He’s become hostile, this resident monk.

pli-tv-kd9:1.2.11.pli: Handa mayaṃ, āvuso, āvāsikaṃ bhikkhuṃ ukkhipāmā”ti.

pli-tv-kd9:1.3.1.pli: Atha kho te āgantukā bhikkhū sannipatitvā kassapagottaṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd9:1.3.1.eng: Soon afterwards those newly-arrived monks gathered and confronted Kassapagotta with what had happened, adding,

pli-tv-kd9:1.3.2.pli: “pubbe kho tvaṃ, āvuso, nahāne ussukkaṃ karosi, ussukkampi karosi yāguyā khādanīye bhattasmiṃ.

pli-tv-kd9:1.3.3.pli: Sodāni tvaṃ na ussukkaṃ karosi yāguyā khādanīye bhattasmiṃ.

pli-tv-kd9:1.3.6.eng: “No. I haven’t committed any offense that I should recognize.”

pli-tv-kd9:1.3.7.pli: Atha kho te āgantukā bhikkhū kassapagottaṃ bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā adassane ukkhipiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd9:1.3.7.eng: Those newly-arrived monks then ejected Kassapagotta for not recognizing an offense.

pli-tv-kd9:1.3.9.pli: “ahaṃ kho etaṃ na jānāmi ‘āpatti vā esā anāpatti vā, āpanno camhi anāpanno vā, ukkhitto camhi anukkhitto vā, dhammikena vā adhammikena vā, kuppena vā akuppena vā, ṭhānārahena vā aṭṭhānārahena vā’.
pli-tv-kd9:1.3.9.eng: “I don’t actually know whether this was an offense or not, whether I’ve committed one or not, whether I’ve been ejected or not, whether it was legitimate or not, whether it’s reversible or not, whether it’s fit to stand or not.

pli-tv-kd9:1.3.10.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ campaṃ gantvā bhagavantaṃ etamatthaṃ puccheyyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd9:1.3.10.eng: Let me go to Campā and ask the Buddha.”

pli-tv-kd9:1.4.1.pli: Atha kho kassapagotto bhikkhu senāsanaṃ saṃsāmetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena campā tena pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd9:1.4.1.eng: He then put his dwelling in order, took his bowl and robe, and set out for Campā.

pli-tv-kd9:1.4.2.pli: Anupubbena yena campā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd9:1.4.2.eng: When he eventually arrived, he went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd9:1.4.3.pli: Āciṇṇaṃ kho panetaṃ buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ āgantukehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ paṭisammodituṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:1.4.3.eng: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly-arrived monks,

pli-tv-kd9:1.4.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā kassapagottaṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd9:1.4.5.eng: “I hope you’re keeping well, monk, I hope you’re getting by?

pli-tv-kd9:1.4.6.eng: I hope you’re not tired from traveling?

pli-tv-kd9:1.4.7.eng: And where have you come from?”

pli-tv-kd9:1.4.8.eng: “I’m keeping well, sir, I’m getting by.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.1.pli: Atthi, bhante, kāsīsu janapade vāsabhagāmo nāma.
pli-tv-kd9:1.5.1.eng: And he told the Buddha all that had happened, adding,

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.2.pli: Tatthāhaṃ, bhagavā, āvāsiko tantibaddho ussukkaṃ āpanno—

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.3.pli: ‘kinti anāgatā ca pesalā bhikkhū āgaccheyyuṃ, āgatā ca pesalā bhikkhū phāsu vihareyyuṃ, ayañca āvāso vuddhiṃ viruḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjeyyā’ti.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.4.pli: Atha kho, bhante, sambahulā bhikkhū kāsīsu cārikaṃ caramānā yena vāsabhagāmo tadavasaruṃ.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.5.pli: Addasaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, te bhikkhū dūratova āgacchante, disvāna āsanaṃ paññapesiṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipiṃ, paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahesiṃ, pānīyena apucchiṃ, nahāne ussukkaṃ akāsiṃ, ussukkampi akāsiṃ yāguyā khādanīye bhattasmiṃ.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.6.pli: Atha kho tesaṃ, bhante, āgantukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.7.pli: ‘bhaddako kho ayaṃ āvuso āvāsiko bhikkhu nahāne ussukkaṃ karoti, ussukkampi karoti yāguyā khādanīye bhattasmiṃ.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.8.pli: Handa mayaṃ, āvuso, idheva vāsabhagāme nivāsaṃ kappemā’ti.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.9.pli: Atha kho te, bhante, āgantukā bhikkhū tattheva vāsabhagāme nivāsaṃ kappesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.11.pli: ‘yo kho imesaṃ āgantukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ āgantukakilamatho so paṭippassaddho.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.12.pli: Yepime gocare appakataññuno tedānime gocare pakataññuno.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.13.pli: Dukkaraṃ kho pana parakulesu yāvajīvaṃ ussukkaṃ kātuṃ, viññatti ca manussānaṃ amanāpā.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.14.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ na ussukkaṃ kareyyaṃ yāguyā khādanīye bhattasmin’ti.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.15.pli: So kho ahaṃ, bhante, na ussukkaṃ akāsiṃ yāguyā khādanīye bhattasmiṃ.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.16.pli: Atha kho tesaṃ, bhante, āgantukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.17.pli: ‘pubbe khvāyaṃ, āvuso, āvāsiko bhikkhu nahāne ussukkaṃ karoti, ussukkampi karoti yāguyā khādanīye bhattasmiṃ.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.18.pli: Sodānāyaṃ na ussukkaṃ karoti yāguyā khādanīye bhattasmiṃ.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.20.pli: Handa mayaṃ, āvuso, āvāsikaṃ bhikkhuṃ ukkhipāmā’ti.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.21.pli: Atha kho te, bhante, āgantukā bhikkhū sannipatitvā maṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.22.pli: ‘pubbe kho tvaṃ, āvuso, nahāne ussukkaṃ karosi, ussukkampi karosi yāguyā khādanīye bhattasmiṃ.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.23.pli: Sodāni tvaṃ na ussukkaṃ karosi yāguyā khādanīye bhattasmiṃ.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.27.pli: Atha kho te, bhante, āgantukā bhikkhū maṃ āpattiyā adassane ukkhipiṃsu.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.29.pli: ‘ahaṃ kho etaṃ na jānāmi “āpatti vā esā anāpatti vā, āpanno camhi anāpanno vā, ukkhitto camhi anukkhitto vā, dhammikena vā adhammikena vā, kuppena vā akuppena vā, ṭhānārahena vā aṭṭhānārahena vā”.

pli-tv-kd9:1.5.30.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ campaṃ gantvā bhagavantaṃ etamatthaṃ puccheyyan’ti.

pli-tv-kd9:1.6.4.eng: You’ve been ejected by an illegitimate legal procedure that’s reversible and unfit to stand.

pli-tv-kd9:1.6.5.pli: Gaccha tvaṃ, bhikkhu, tattheva vāsabhagāme nivāsaṃ kappehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd9:1.6.5.eng: Go back and stay right there in the village of Vāsabha.”

pli-tv-kd9:1.6.6.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho kassapagotto bhikkhu bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā yena vāsabhagāmo tena pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd9:1.6.6.eng: “Yes, sir.” He got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and set out for Vāsabha.

pli-tv-kd9:1.7.1.pli: Atha kho tesaṃ āgantukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ ahudeva kukkuccaṃ, ahu vippaṭisāro—
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.1.eng: Soon those newly-arrived monks became anxious and remorseful:

pli-tv-kd9:1.7.2.pli: “alābhā vata no, na vata no lābhā;

pli-tv-kd9:1.7.3.pli: dulladdhaṃ vata no, na vata no suladdhaṃ, ye mayaṃ suddhaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpattikaṃ avatthusmiṃ akāraṇe ukkhipimhā.
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.3.eng: that we have ejected, without reason, a pure monk who hadn’t committed any offense.

pli-tv-kd9:1.7.4.pli: Handa mayaṃ, āvuso, campaṃ gantvā bhagavato santike accayaṃ accayato desemā”ti.
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.4.eng: Well then, let’s go to Campā and confess our mistake to the Buddha.”

pli-tv-kd9:1.7.5.pli: Atha kho te āgantukā bhikkhū senāsanaṃ saṃsāmetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena campā tena pakkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.5.eng: They then put their dwellings in order, took their bowls and robes, and set out for Campā.

pli-tv-kd9:1.7.6.pli: Anupubbena yena campā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.6.eng: When they eventually arrived, they went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd9:1.7.7.pli: Āciṇṇaṃ kho panetaṃ buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ āgantukehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ paṭisammodituṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.7.eng: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly-arrived monks,

pli-tv-kd9:1.7.8.pli: Atha kho bhagavā te bhikkhū etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd9:1.7.9.eng: “I hope you’re keeping well, monks, I hope you’re getting by?

pli-tv-kd9:1.7.10.eng: I hope you’re not tired from traveling?

pli-tv-kd9:1.7.11.eng: And where have you come from?”

pli-tv-kd9:1.7.12.eng: “We’re keeping well, sir, we’re getting by.

pli-tv-kd9:1.7.13.pli: appakilamathena ca mayaṃ, bhante, addhānaṃ āgatā.

pli-tv-kd9:1.7.14.pli: Atthi, bhante, kāsīsu janapade vāsabhagāmo nāma.
pli-tv-kd9:1.7.14.eng: There’s a village in the country of Kāsi called Vāsabha.

pli-tv-kd9:1.8.1.eng: “Are you the ones who ejected the resident monk?”

pli-tv-kd9:1.8.6.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisā, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:1.8.6.eng: “Foolish men, it’s not suitable, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:1.8.7.pli: Kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, suddhaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpattikaṃ avatthusmiṃ akāraṇe ukkhipissatha.
pli-tv-kd9:1.8.7.eng: How could you, without reason, eject a pure monk who hadn’t committed any offense?

pli-tv-kd9:1.8.9.pli: vigarahitvā dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd9:1.8.9.eng: After rebuking them … he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd9:1.8.10.pli: “na, bhikkhave, suddho bhikkhu anāpattiko avatthusmiṃ akāraṇe ukkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd9:1.8.10.eng: “You shouldn’t, without reason, eject a pure monk who hasn’t committed any offense.

pli-tv-kd9:1.8.11.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd9:1.9.1.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd9:1.9.1.eng: Those monks then got up from their seats, arranged their upper robes over one shoulder, bowed down with their heads at the Buddha’s feet, and said,

pli-tv-kd9:1.9.2.pli: “accayo no, bhante, accagamā yathābāle yathāmūḷhe yathāakusale, ye mayaṃ suddhaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpattikaṃ avatthusmiṃ akāraṇe ukkhipimhā.
pli-tv-kd9:1.9.2.eng: “Sir, we have made a mistake. We’ve been foolish, confused, and unskillful in ejecting, without reason, a pure monk who hadn’t committed any offense.

pli-tv-kd9:1.9.3.pli: Tesaṃ no, bhante, bhagavā accayaṃ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu āyatiṃ saṃvarāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd9:1.9.3.eng: Please accept our confession so that we may restrain ourselves in the future.”

pli-tv-kd9:1.9.4.pli: “Taggha tumhe, bhikkhave, accayo accagamā yathābāle yathāmūḷhe yathāakusale, ye tumhe suddhaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpattikaṃ avatthusmiṃ akāraṇe ukkhipittha.
pli-tv-kd9:1.9.4.eng: “You have certainly made a mistake. You’ve been foolish, confused, and unskillful.

pli-tv-kd9:1.9.5.pli: Yato ca kho tumhe, bhikkhave, accayaṃ accayato disvā yathādhammaṃ paṭikarotha, taṃ vo mayaṃ paṭiggaṇhāma.
pli-tv-kd9:1.9.5.eng: But since you acknowledge your mistake and make proper amends, I forgive you.

pli-tv-kd9:1.9.6.pli: Vuddhihesā, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye yo accayaṃ accayato disvā yathādhammaṃ paṭikaroti, āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd9:1.9.6.eng: For this is called growth in the training of the noble ones: acknowledging a mistake, making proper amends, and undertaking restraint for the future.”

pli-tv-kd9:2.1.0.eng: 2. Discussion of illegitimate legal procedures done by an incomplete assembly, etc.

pli-tv-kd9:2.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena campāyaṃ bhikkhū evarūpāni kammāni karonti—
pli-tv-kd9:2.1.1.eng: At that time the monks at Campā did legal procedures such as these:

pli-tv-kd9:2.1.2.pli: adhammena vaggakammaṃ karonti, adhammena samaggakammaṃ karonti;
pli-tv-kd9:2.1.2.eng: illegitimate legal procedures done by an incomplete assembly, illegitimate legal procedures done by a unanimous assembly,

pli-tv-kd9:2.1.3.pli: dhammena vaggakammaṃ karonti, dhammapatirūpakena vaggakammaṃ karonti;
pli-tv-kd9:2.1.3.eng: legitimate legal procedures done by an incomplete assembly, legitimate-like legal procedures done by an incomplete assembly,

pli-tv-kd9:2.1.4.eng: legitimate-like legal procedures done by a unanimous assembly,

pli-tv-kd9:2.1.5.pli: ekopi ekaṃ ukkhipati, ekopi dve ukkhipati, ekopi sambahule ukkhipati, ekopi saṅghaṃ ukkhipati;
pli-tv-kd9:2.1.5.eng: one person ejecting another, one ejecting two, one ejecting three, one ejecting a sangha,
pli-tv-kd9:2.1.5.comm: “Three” renders sambahula. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd9:2.1.6.pli: dvepi ekaṃ ukkhipanti, dvepi dve ukkhipanti, dvepi sambahule ukkhipanti, dvepi saṅghaṃ ukkhipanti;
pli-tv-kd9:2.1.6.eng: two ejecting one, two ejecting two, two ejecting three, two ejecting a sangha,

pli-tv-kd9:2.1.8.pli: sambahulāpi dve ukkhipanti, sambahulāpi sambahule ukkhipanti, sambahulāpi saṅghaṃ ukkhipanti;
pli-tv-kd9:2.1.8.eng: three ejecting two, three ejecting three, three ejecting a sangha,

pli-tv-kd9:2.2.1.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd9:2.2.1.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd9:2.2.2.pli: “kathañhi nāma campāyaṃ bhikkhū evarūpāni kammāni karissanti—
pli-tv-kd9:2.2.2.eng: “How can the monks at Campā do such legal procedures?”

pli-tv-kd9:2.2.3.pli: adhammena vaggakammaṃ karissanti, adhammena samaggakammaṃ karissanti, dhammena vaggakammaṃ karissanti, dhammapatirūpakena vaggakammaṃ karissanti, dhammapatirūpakena samaggakammaṃ karissanti, ekopi ekaṃ ukkhipissati, ekopi dve ukkhipissati, ekopi sambahule ukkhipissati, ekopi saṅghaṃ ukkhipissati, dvepi ekaṃ ukkhipissanti, dvepi dve ukkhipissanti, dvepi sambahule ukkhipissanti, dvepi saṅghaṃ ukkhipissanti, sambahulāpi ekaṃ ukkhipissanti, sambahulāpi dve ukkhipissanti, sambahulāpi sambahule ukkhipissanti, sambahulāpi saṅghaṃ ukkhipissanti, saṅghopi saṅghaṃ ukkhipissatī”ti.

pli-tv-kd9:2.2.4.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd9:2.2.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, campāyaṃ bhikkhū evarūpāni kammāni karonti—
pli-tv-kd9:2.2.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the monks at Campā do this?”

pli-tv-kd9:2.2.10.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, bhikkhave, tesaṃ moghapurisānaṃ ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:2.2.10.eng: “It’s not suitable for those foolish men, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.2.11.pli: Kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā evarūpāni kammāni karissanti—
pli-tv-kd9:2.2.11.eng: How can they do such legal procedures?

pli-tv-kd9:2.2.16.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd9:2.3.1.pli: “Adhammena ce, bhikkhave, vaggakammaṃ akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ,
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.1.eng: “Illegitimate legal procedures done by an incomplete assembly are invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.3.2.pli: adhammena samaggakammaṃ akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ,
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.2.eng: Illegitimate legal procedures done by a unanimous assembly are invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.3.3.pli: dhammena vaggakammaṃ akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.3.eng: Legitimate legal procedures done by an incomplete assembly are invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.3.4.pli: dhammapatirūpakena vaggakammaṃ akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ,
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.4.eng: Legitimate-like legal procedures done by an incomplete assembly are invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.3.5.pli: dhammapatirūpakena samaggakammaṃ akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.5.eng: Legitimate-like legal procedures done by a unanimous assembly are invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.3.6.pli: ekopi ekaṃ ukkhipati akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ,
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.6.eng: One person ejecting another is invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.3.7.pli: ekopi dve ukkhipati akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ,
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.7.eng: One ejecting two is invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.3.8.pli: ekopi sambahule ukkhipati akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ,
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.8.eng: One ejecting three is invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.3.9.pli: ekopi saṅghaṃ ukkhipati akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ;,
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.9.eng: One ejecting a sangha is invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.3.10.pli: dvepi ekaṃ ukkhipanti akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ,
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.10.eng: Two ejecting one is invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.3.11.pli: dvepi dve ukkhipanti akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ,
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.11.eng: Two ejecting two is invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.3.12.pli: dvepi sambahule ukkhipanti akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ,
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.12.eng: Two ejecting three is invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.3.13.pli: dvepi saṅghaṃ ukkhipanti akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ;,
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.13.eng: Two ejecting a sangha is invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.3.14.pli: sambahulāpi ekaṃ ukkhipanti akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ,
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.14.eng: Three ejecting one is invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.3.15.pli: sambahulāpi dve ukkhipanti akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ,
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.15.eng: Three ejecting two is invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.3.16.pli: sambahulāpi sambahule ukkhipanti akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ,
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.16.eng: Three ejecting three is invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.3.17.pli: sambahulāpi saṅghaṃ ukkhipanti akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ;,
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.17.eng: Three ejecting a sangha is invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.3.18.pli: saṅghopi saṅghaṃ ukkhipati akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:2.3.18.eng: A sangha ejecting a sangha is invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:2.4.1.eng: There are four kinds of legal procedures:

pli-tv-kd9:2.4.2.pli: adhammena vaggakammaṃ, adhammena samaggakammaṃ, dhammena vaggakammaṃ, dhammena samaggakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.2.eng: an illegitimate legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly, an illegitimate legal procedure done by a unanimous assembly, a legitimate legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly, and a legitimate legal procedure done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd9:2.4.3.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yadidaṃ adhammena vaggakammaṃ, idaṃ, bhikkhave, kammaṃ adhammattā vaggattā kuppaṃ aṭṭhānārahaṃ;
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.3.eng: The illegitimate legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly is reversible and unfit to stand, because it’s illegitimate and the assembly is incomplete.

pli-tv-kd9:2.4.4.pli: na, bhikkhave, evarūpaṃ kammaṃ kātabbaṃ, na ca mayā evarūpaṃ kammaṃ anuññātaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.4.eng: You shouldn’t do such procedures. I haven’t allowed such procedures.

pli-tv-kd9:2.4.5.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yadidaṃ adhammena samaggakammaṃ, idaṃ, bhikkhave, kammaṃ adhammattā kuppaṃ aṭṭhānārahaṃ;
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.5.eng: The illegitimate legal procedure done by a unanimous assembly is reversible and unfit to stand, because it’s illegitimate.

pli-tv-kd9:2.4.6.pli: na, bhikkhave, evarūpaṃ kammaṃ kātabbaṃ, na ca mayā evarūpaṃ kammaṃ anuññātaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.6.eng: You shouldn’t do such procedures. I haven’t allowed such procedures.

pli-tv-kd9:2.4.7.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yadidaṃ dhammena vaggakammaṃ, idaṃ, bhikkhave, kammaṃ vaggattā kuppaṃ aṭṭhānārahaṃ;
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.7.eng: The legitimate legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly is reversible and unfit to stand, because the assembly is incomplete.

pli-tv-kd9:2.4.8.pli: na, bhikkhave, evarūpaṃ kammaṃ kātabbaṃ, na ca mayā evarūpaṃ kammaṃ anuññātaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.8.eng: You shouldn’t do such procedures. I haven’t allowed such procedures.

pli-tv-kd9:2.4.9.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yadidaṃ dhammena samaggakammaṃ, idaṃ, bhikkhave, kammaṃ dhammattā samaggattā akuppaṃ ṭhānārahaṃ;
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.9.eng: The legitimate legal procedure done by a unanimous assembly is irreversible and fit to stand, because it’s legitimate and the assembly is unanimous.

pli-tv-kd9:2.4.10.pli: evarūpaṃ, bhikkhave, kammaṃ kātabbaṃ, evarūpañca mayā kammaṃ anuññātaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.10.eng: You should do such procedures. I have allowed such procedures.

pli-tv-kd9:2.4.11.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, evarūpaṃ kammaṃ karissāma yadidaṃ dhammena samagganti—
pli-tv-kd9:2.4.11.eng: And so, monks, you should train yourselves like this: ‘We will perform legitimate legal procedures done by a unanimous assembly.’”

pli-tv-kd9:3.1.0.eng: 3. Discussion of legal procedures deficient in motion, etc.

pli-tv-kd9:3.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū evarūpāni kammāni karonti—
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.1.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six did legal procedures such as these:

pli-tv-kd9:3.1.2.pli: adhammena vaggakammaṃ karonti, adhammena samaggakammaṃ karonti;
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.2.eng: illegitimate procedures done by an incomplete assembly; illegitimate procedures done by a unanimous assembly;

pli-tv-kd9:3.1.3.pli: dhammena vaggakammaṃ karonti, dhammapatirūpakena vaggakammaṃ karonti, dhammapatirūpakena samaggakammaṃ karonti;
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.3.eng: legitimate procedures done by an incomplete assembly; legitimate-like procedures done by an incomplete assembly; legitimate-like procedures done by a unanimous assembly;

pli-tv-kd9:3.1.4.pli: ñattivipannampi kammaṃ karonti anussāvanasampannaṃ, anussāvanavipannampi kammaṃ karonti ñattisampannaṃ, ñattivipannampi anussāvanavipannampi kammaṃ karonti;
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.4.eng: procedures deficient in motion but complete in announcement; procedures deficient in announcement but complete in motion; procedures deficient in both motion and announcement;
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.4.comm: “Announcement” renders anussāvana. When used to describe elements of a saṅghakamma, “a legal procedure”, anussāvana and kammavācā are used synonymously. In these cases they refer to the one or three “announcements” that follow the motion, and so I render them both as “announcement”. Occasionally, however, anussāvana, but not kammavācā, is used to describe the full legal procedure of both motion and announcements. In such instances I render it as “proclamation”.

pli-tv-kd9:3.1.5.pli: aññatrāpi dhammā kammaṃ karonti, aññatrāpi vinayā kammaṃ karonti, aññatrāpi satthusāsanā kammaṃ karonti;
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.5.eng: procedures not done according to the Teaching; procedures not done according to the Monastic Law; procedures not done according to the Teacher’s instructions;

pli-tv-kd9:3.1.6.pli: paṭikuṭṭhakatampi kammaṃ karonti adhammikaṃ kuppaṃ aṭṭhānārahaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.6.eng: procedures that had been objected to, that were illegitimate, reversible, and unfit to stand.

pli-tv-kd9:3.1.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.7.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd9:3.1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū evarūpāni kammāni karissanti—
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.8.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six do such legal procedures?”

pli-tv-kd9:3.1.9.pli: adhammena vaggakammaṃ karissanti, adhammena samaggakammaṃ karissanti;

pli-tv-kd9:3.1.10.pli: dhammena vaggakammaṃ karissanti, dhammapatirūpakena vaggakammaṃ karissanti, dhammapatirūpakena samaggakammaṃ karissanti;

pli-tv-kd9:3.1.11.pli: ñattivipannampi kammaṃ karissanti anussāvanasampannaṃ, anussāvanavipannampi kammaṃ karissanti ñattisampannaṃ, ñattivipannampi anussāvanavipannampi kammaṃ karissanti;

pli-tv-kd9:3.1.12.pli: aññatrāpi dhammā kammaṃ karissanti, aññatrāpi vinayā kammaṃ karissanti, aññatrāpi satthusāsanā kammaṃ karissanti;

pli-tv-kd9:3.1.13.pli: paṭikuṭṭhakatampi kammaṃ karissanti adhammikaṃ kuppaṃ aṭṭhānārahan”ti.

pli-tv-kd9:3.1.14.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd9:3.1.15.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhū evarūpāni kammāni karonti—
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.15.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the monks from the group of six do this?”

pli-tv-kd9:3.1.17.pli: paṭikuṭṭhakatampi kammaṃ karonti adhammikaṃ kuppaṃ aṭṭhānārahan”ti?

pli-tv-kd9:3.1.20.pli: vigarahitvā dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd9:3.1.20.eng: He then gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd9:3.2.1.pli: “Adhammena ce, bhikkhave, vaggakammaṃ akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.1.eng: “Illegitimate legal procedures done by an incomplete assembly are invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:3.2.2.pli: adhammena samaggakammaṃ akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.2.eng: Illegitimate legal procedures done by a unanimous assembly are invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:3.2.3.pli: dhammena vaggakammaṃ akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.3.eng: Legitimate legal procedures done by an incomplete assembly are invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:3.2.4.pli: dhammapatirūpakena vaggakammaṃ akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.4.eng: Legitimate-like legal procedures done by an incomplete assembly are invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:3.2.5.pli: dhammapatirūpakena samaggakammaṃ akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.5.eng: Legitimate-like legal procedures done by a unanimous assembly are invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:3.2.6.pli: Ñattivipannañce, bhikkhave, kammaṃ anussāvanasampannaṃ akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.6.eng: Legal procedures deficient in motion but complete in announcement are invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:3.2.7.pli: anussāvanavipannañce, bhikkhave, kammaṃ ñattisampannaṃ akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.7.eng: Legal procedures deficient in announcement but complete in motion are invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:3.2.8.pli: ñattivipannañce, bhikkhave, kammaṃ anussāvanavipannaṃ akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.8.eng: Legal procedures deficient in both motion and announcement are invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:3.2.9.pli: aññatrāpi dhammā kammaṃ akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.9.eng: Legal procedures not done according to the Teaching are invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:3.2.10.pli: aññatrāpi vinayā kammaṃ akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.10.eng: Legal procedures not done according to the Monastic Law are invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:3.2.11.pli: aññatrāpi satthusāsanā kammaṃ akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ;
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.11.eng: Legal procedures not done according to the Teacher’s instructions are invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:3.2.12.pli: paṭikuṭṭhakatañce, bhikkhave, kammaṃ adhammikaṃ kuppaṃ aṭṭhānārahaṃ akammaṃ na ca karaṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.2.12.eng: Legal procedures that have been objected to, that are illegitimate, reversible, and unfit to stand are invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:3.3.1.eng: And, monks, there are six kinds of legal procedures:

pli-tv-kd9:3.3.2.pli: adhammakammaṃ, vaggakammaṃ, samaggakammaṃ, dhammapatirūpakena vaggakammaṃ, dhammapatirūpakena samaggakammaṃ, dhammena samaggakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.3.2.eng: illegitimate legal procedures, legal procedures done by an incomplete assembly, legal procedures done by a unanimous assembly, legitimate-like legal procedures done by an incomplete assembly, legitimate-like legal procedures done by a unanimous assembly, legitimate legal procedures done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd9:3.3.4.pli: Ñattidutiye ce, bhikkhave, kamme ekāya ñattiyā kammaṃ karoti, na ca kammavācaṃ anussāveti—adhammakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.3.4.eng: If a procedure requires one motion and one announcement, but they do it with one motion and no announcement, it’s an illegitimate legal procedure.

pli-tv-kd9:3.3.5.pli: Ñattidutiye ce, bhikkhave, kamme dvīhi ñattīhi kammaṃ karoti, na ca kammavācaṃ anussāveti—adhammakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.3.5.eng: If a procedure requires one motion and one announcement, but they do it with two motions and no announcement, it’s an illegitimate legal procedure.

pli-tv-kd9:3.3.6.pli: Ñattidutiye ce, bhikkhave, kamme ekāya kammavācāya kammaṃ karoti, na ca ñattiṃ ṭhapeti—adhammakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.3.6.eng: If a procedure requires one motion and one announcement, but they do it with one announcement and no motion, it’s an illegitimate legal procedure.

pli-tv-kd9:3.3.7.pli: Ñattidutiye ce, bhikkhave, kamme dvīhi kammavācāhi kammaṃ karoti, na ca ñattiṃ ṭhapeti—adhammakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.3.7.eng: If a procedure requires one motion and one announcement, but they do it with two announcements and no motion, it’s an illegitimate legal procedure.

pli-tv-kd9:3.4.1.pli: Ñatticatutthe ce, bhikkhave, kamme ekāya ñattiyā kammaṃ karoti, na ca kammavācaṃ anussāveti—
pli-tv-kd9:3.4.1.eng: If a procedure requires one motion and three announcements, but they do it with one motion and no announcement,

pli-tv-kd9:3.4.2.eng: it is an illegitimate legal procedure.

pli-tv-kd9:3.4.3.pli: Ñatticatutthe ce, bhikkhave, kamme dvīhi ñattīhi kammaṃ karoti, na ca kammavācaṃ anussāveti—adhammakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.4.3.eng: If a procedure requires one motion and three announcements, but they do it with two motions and no announcement, it’s an illegitimate legal procedure.

pli-tv-kd9:3.4.4.pli: Ñatticatutthe ce, bhikkhave, kamme tīhi ñattīhi kammaṃ karoti, na ca kammavācaṃ anussāveti—adhammakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.4.4.eng: If a procedure requires one motion and three announcements, but they do it with three motions and no announcement, it’s an illegitimate legal procedure.

pli-tv-kd9:3.4.5.pli: Ñatticatutthe ce, bhikkhave, kamme catūhi ñattīhi kammaṃ karoti, na ca kammavācaṃ anussāveti—adhammakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.4.5.eng: If a procedure requires one motion and three announcements, but they do it with four motions and no announcement, it’s an illegitimate legal procedure.

pli-tv-kd9:3.4.6.pli: Ñatticatutthe ce, bhikkhave, kamme ekāya kammavācāya kammaṃ karoti, na ca ñattiṃ ṭhapeti—adhammakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.4.6.eng: If a procedure requires one motion and three announcements, but they do it with one announcement and no motion, it’s an illegitimate legal procedure.

pli-tv-kd9:3.4.7.pli: Ñatticatutthe ce, bhikkhave, kamme dvīhi kammavācāhi kammaṃ karoti, na ca ñattiṃ ṭhapeti—adhammakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.4.7.eng: If a procedure requires one motion and three announcements, but they do it with two announcements and no motion, it’s an illegitimate legal procedure.

pli-tv-kd9:3.4.8.pli: Ñatticatutthe ce, bhikkhave, kamme tīhi kammavācāhi kammaṃ karoti, na ca ñattiṃ ṭhapeti—adhammakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.4.8.eng: If a procedure requires one motion and three announcements, but they do it with three announcements and no motion, it’s an illegitimate legal procedure.

pli-tv-kd9:3.4.9.pli: Ñatticatutthe ce, bhikkhave, kamme catūhi kammavācāhi kammaṃ karoti, na ca ñattiṃ ṭhapeti—adhammakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.4.9.eng: If a procedure requires one motion and three announcements, but they do it with four announcements and no motion, it’s an illegitimate legal procedure.

pli-tv-kd9:3.5.1.eng: And what’s a legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly?

pli-tv-kd9:3.5.2.pli: Ñattidutiye ce, bhikkhave, kamme yāvatikā bhikkhū kammappattā te anāgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando anāhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā paṭikkosanti—vaggakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.5.2.eng: When a procedure requires one motion and one announcement, but the monks who should take part haven’t all arrived, and the consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, and someone present objects to the decision, then it’s a legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.
pli-tv-kd9:3.5.2.comm: Sp 3.388: Kammappattoti kammaṁ patto, kammayutto kammāraho; na kiñci kammaṁ kātuṁ nārahatīti attho, “‘Who should be present’: who are able in regard to the legal procedure, suitable for the legal procedure, fit for the legal procedure. The meaning is that one should not not do any kind of legal procedure.” The last line means one should or must be present at the legal procedure.

pli-tv-kd9:3.5.3.pli: Ñattidutiye ce, bhikkhave, kamme yāvatikā bhikkhū kammappattā te āgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando anāhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā paṭikkosanti—vaggakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.5.3.eng: When a procedure requires one motion and one announcement, and the monks who should take part have arrived, but the consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, and someone present objects to the decision, then it’s a legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd9:3.5.4.eng: When a procedure requires one motion and one announcement, and the monks who should take part have arrived, and consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, but someone present objects to the decision, then it’s a legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd9:3.5.5.pli: Ñatticatutthe ce, bhikkhave, kamme yāvatikā bhikkhū kammappattā te anāgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando anāhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā paṭikkosanti—vaggakammaṃ.

pli-tv-kd9:3.6.1.eng: And what’s a legal procedure done by a unanimous assembly?

pli-tv-kd9:3.6.2.pli: Ñattidutiye ce, bhikkhave, kamme yāvatikā bhikkhū kammappattā, te āgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando āhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā na paṭikkosanti—samaggakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.6.2.eng: When a procedure requires one motion and one announcement, and the monks who should take part have arrived, and consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, and no-one present objects to the decision, then it’s a legal procedure done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd9:3.6.3.pli: Ñatticatutthe ce, bhikkhave, kamme yāvatikā bhikkhū kammappattā, te āgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando āhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā na paṭikkosanti—samaggakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.6.3.eng: When a procedure requires one motion and three announcements, and the monks who should take part have arrived, and consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, and no-one present objects to the decision, then it’s a legal procedure done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd9:3.7.1.eng: And what’s a legitimate-like legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly?

pli-tv-kd9:3.7.2.pli: Ñattidutiye ce, bhikkhave, kamme paṭhamaṃ kammavācaṃ anussāveti, pacchā ñattiṃ ṭhapeti, yāvatikā bhikkhū kammappattā te anāgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando anāhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā paṭikkosanti—dhammapatirūpakena vaggakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.7.2.eng: When a procedure requires one motion and one announcement, but they make the announcement first and put forward the motion afterwards, and the monks who should take part haven’t all arrived, and consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, and someone present objects to the decision, then it’s a legitimate-like legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd9:3.7.3.eng: When a procedure requires one motion and one announcement, but they make the announcement first and put forward the motion afterwards, yet the monks who should take part have arrived, but consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, and someone present objects to the decision, then it’s a legitimate-like legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd9:3.7.5.eng: When a procedure requires one motion and three announcements, but they make the announcements first and put forward the motion afterwards, and if the monks who should take part haven’t all arrived, and consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, and someone present objects to the decision, then it’s a legitimate-like legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd9:3.7.6.eng: When a procedure requires one motion and three announcements, but they make the announcements first and put forward the motion afterwards, yet the monks who should take part have arrived, but consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, and someone present objects to the decision, then it’s a legitimate-like legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd9:3.8.2.pli: Ñattidutiye ce, bhikkhave, kamme paṭhamaṃ kammavācaṃ anussāveti, pacchā ñattiṃ ṭhapeti, yāvatikā bhikkhū kammappattā, te āgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando āhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā na paṭikkosanti—dhammapatirūpakena samaggakammaṃ.

pli-tv-kd9:3.9.1.eng: And what is a legitimate legal procedure done by a unanimous assembly?

pli-tv-kd9:3.9.2.pli: Ñattidutiye ce, bhikkhave, kamme paṭhamaṃ ñattiṃ ṭhapeti, pacchā ekāya kammavācāya kammaṃ karoti, yāvatikā bhikkhū kammappattā te āgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando āhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā na paṭikkosanti—dhammena samaggakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.9.2.eng: When a procedure requires one motion and one announcement, and they put forward the motion first and make the announcement afterwards, and the monks who should take part have arrived, and consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, and no-one present objects to the decision, then it’s a legitimate legal procedure done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd9:3.9.3.pli: Ñatticatutthe ce, bhikkhave, kamme paṭhamaṃ ñattiṃ ṭhapeti, pacchā tīhi kammavācāhi kammaṃ karoti, yāvatikā bhikkhū kammappattā, te āgatā honti, chandārahānaṃ chando āhaṭo hoti, sammukhībhūtā na paṭikkosanti, dhammena samaggakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd9:3.9.3.eng: When a procedure requires one motion and three announcements, and they put forward the motion first and make the announcements afterwards, and the monks who should take part have arrived, and consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent, and no-one present objects to the decision, then it’s a legitimate legal procedure done by a unanimous assembly.”

pli-tv-kd9:4.1.0.eng: 4. Discussion of what can be done by a group of four, etc.

pli-tv-kd9:4.1.2.pli: catuvaggo bhikkhusaṅgho pañcavaggo bhikkhusaṅgho, dasavaggo bhikkhusaṅgho, vīsativaggo bhikkhusaṅgho, atirekavīsativaggo bhikkhusaṅgho.
pli-tv-kd9:4.1.2.eng: a sangha of monks consisting of a group of four, a sangha of monks consisting of a group of five, a sangha of monks consisting of a group of ten, a sangha of monks consisting of a group of twenty, a sangha of monks consisting of a group of more than twenty.

pli-tv-kd9:4.1.3.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ catuvaggo bhikkhusaṅgho, ṭhapetvā tīṇi kammāni—
pli-tv-kd9:4.1.3.eng: A Sangha of monks consisting of a group of four—unanimous, acting legitimately—is able to do all legal procedures except three:

pli-tv-kd9:4.1.4.pli: upasampadaṃ pavāraṇaṃ abbhānaṃ, dhammena samaggo sabbakammesu kammappatto.

pli-tv-kd9:4.1.5.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ pañcavaggo bhikkhusaṅgho, ṭhapetvā dve kammāni—
pli-tv-kd9:4.1.5.eng: A Sangha of monks consisting of a group of five—unanimous, acting legitimately—is able to do all legal procedures except two:

pli-tv-kd9:4.1.6.pli: majjhimesu janapadesu upasampadaṃ abbhānaṃ, dhammena samaggo sabbakammesu kammappatto.
pli-tv-kd9:4.1.6.eng: ordination within the central Ganges plain and rehabilitation.

pli-tv-kd9:4.1.7.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ dasavaggo bhikkhusaṅgho, ṭhapetvā ekaṃ kammaṃ—
pli-tv-kd9:4.1.7.eng: A Sangha of monks consisting of a group of ten—unanimous, acting legitimately—is able to do all legal procedures except one:

pli-tv-kd9:4.1.9.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ vīsativaggo bhikkhusaṅgho dhammena samaggo sabbakammesu kammappatto.
pli-tv-kd9:4.1.9.eng: A Sangha of monks consisting of a group of twenty—unanimous, acting legitimately—is able to do all legal procedures.

pli-tv-kd9:4.1.10.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ atirekavīsativaggo bhikkhusaṅgho dhammena samaggo sabbakammesu kammappatto.
pli-tv-kd9:4.1.10.eng: A Sangha of monks consisting of a group of more than twenty—unanimous, acting legitimately—is able to do all legal procedures.

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.1.pli: Catuvaggakaraṇañce, bhikkhave, kammaṃ bhikkhunicatuttho kammaṃ kareyya—
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.1.eng: If a legal procedure that requires a group of four is done with a nun as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.2.eng: it’s invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.3.pli: Catuvaggakaraṇañce, bhikkhave, kammaṃ sikkhamānacatuttho kammaṃ kareyya …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.3.eng: If a legal procedure that requires a group of four is done with a trainee nun as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.5.eng: with a novice monk as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.7.eng: with a novice nun as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.9.eng: with one who’s renounced the training as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.11.eng: with one who’s committed the worst kind of offense as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.11.comm: Sp-yoj 5.483: Antimavatthunti pārājikavatthuṁ; “Antimavatthu: an action that is the basis for an offense entailing expulsion.”

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.13.eng: with one who’s been ejected for not recognizing an offense as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.15.eng: with one who’s been ejected for not making amends for an offense as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.17.pli: Pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhittakacatuttho kammaṃ kareyya …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.17.eng: with one who’s been ejected for not giving up a bad view as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.19.eng: with a paṇḍaka as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.21.eng: with a fake monk as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.23.eng: with one who’s previously left to join the monastics of another religion as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.25.eng: with an animal as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.27.eng: with a matricide as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.29.eng: with a patricide as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.31.eng: with a murderer of a perfected one as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.33.eng: with one who’s raped a nun as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.35.eng: with one who’s caused a schism in the Sangha as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.37.eng: with one who’s caused the Buddha to bleed as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.39.eng: with a hermaphrodite as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.41.eng: with one belonging to a different Buddhist sect as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.41.comm: Nānāsaṁvāsaka (and samānasaṁvāsaka) need to be carefully distinguished from nānāsaṁvāsa (and samānasaṁvāsa). Only the former means “one belonging to a different Buddhist sect”. The latter means “belonging to a different community”, as decided by sīmās.

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.43.eng: with one who’s outside the monastery zone as the fourth member,
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.43.comm: Nānāsīmāya literally means “within a different monastery zone”. Sp 3.389: Nānāsīmāya ṭhitacatutthoti sīmantarikāya vā bahisīmāya vā hatthapāse ṭhitenāpi saddhiṁ catuvaggo hutvāti attho, “Nānāsīmāya ṭhitacatuttho, the meaning is: having been a group of four, including one who, even if within arm’s reach, is in the space between monastery zones or outside the monastery zone.”

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.45.eng: with one floating in the air by supernormal power as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.47.pli: Yassa saṅgho kammaṃ karoti, taṃcatuttho kammaṃ kareyya …
pli-tv-kd9:4.2.47.eng: or with one who’s subject to the legal procedure as the fourth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.2.48.eng: it’s invalid and not to be done.”

pli-tv-kd9:4.4.4.eng: with a novice monk as the tenth member, with a novice nun as the tenth member, with one who’s renounced the training as the tenth member, with one who’s committed the worst kind of offense as the tenth member, with one who’s been ejected for not recognizing an offense as the tenth member, with one who’s been ejected for not making amends for an offense as the tenth member, with one who’s been ejected for not giving up a bad view as the tenth member, with a paṇḍaka as the tenth member, with one living in the community by theft as the tenth member, with one who’s previously left to join the monastics of another religion as the tenth member, with an animal as the tenth member, with a matricide as the tenth member, with a patricide as the tenth member, with a murderer of a perfected one as the tenth member, with one who’s raped a nun as the tenth member, with one who’s caused a schism in the Sangha as the tenth member, with one who’s caused the Buddha to bleed as the tenth member, with a hermaphrodite as the tenth member, with one belonging to a different Buddhist sect as the tenth member, with one who’s outside the monastery zone as the tenth member, with one floating in the air by supernormal power as the tenth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.4.5.eng: or with one who’s subject to the legal procedure as the tenth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.5.2.eng: “If a legal procedure that requires a group of twenty is done with a nun as the twentieth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.5.3.eng: it’s invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:4.5.4.pli: Vīsativaggakaraṇañce, bhikkhave, kammaṃ sikkhamānavīso kammaṃ kareyya …pe…
pli-tv-kd9:4.5.4.eng: If a legal procedure that requires a group of twenty is done with a trainee nun as the twentieth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.5.6.eng: with a novice nun as the twentieth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.5.16.eng: with a matricide as the twentieth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.5.17.eng: with a patricide as the twentieth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.5.18.eng: with a murderer of a perfected one as the twentieth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.5.20.eng: with one who’s caused a schism in the Sangha as the twentieth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.5.21.eng: with one who’s caused the Buddha to bleed as the twentieth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.5.22.eng: with a hermaphrodite as the twentieth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.5.23.eng: with one belonging to a different Buddhist sect as the twentieth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.5.24.eng: with one who’s outside the monastery zone as the twentieth member,

pli-tv-kd9:4.6.1.eng: Procedures requiring a group of twenty is finished.

pli-tv-kd9:4.6.2.0.eng: 5. Discussion of the one on probation, etc.

pli-tv-kd9:4.6.2.1.pli: Pārivāsikacatuttho ce, bhikkhave, parivāsaṃ dadeyya, mūlāya paṭikasseyya, mānattaṃ dadeyya, taṃvīso abbheyya—
pli-tv-kd9:4.6.2.1.eng: “If a group with one on probation as the fourth member gives probation, sends back to the beginning, or gives the trial period, or a group with one on probation as the twentieth member rehabilitates,

pli-tv-kd9:4.6.3.eng: it’s invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:4.6.4.pli: Mūlāyapaṭikassanārahacatuttho ce, bhikkhave, parivāsaṃ dadeyya, mūlāya paṭikasseyya, mānattaṃ dadeyya, taṃvīso abbheyya—
pli-tv-kd9:4.6.4.eng: If a group with one deserving to be sent back to the beginning as the fourth member gives probation, sends back to the beginning, or gives the trial period, or a group with one deserving to be sent back to the beginning as the twentieth member rehabilitates,

pli-tv-kd9:4.6.5.eng: it’s invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:4.6.6.pli: Mānattārahacatuttho ce, bhikkhave, parivāsaṃ dadeyya, mūlāya paṭikasseyya, mānattaṃ dadeyya, taṃvīso abbheyya—
pli-tv-kd9:4.6.6.eng: If a group with one deserving the trial period as the fourth member gives probation, sends back to the beginning, or gives the trial period, or a group with one deserving a trial period as the twentieth member rehabilitates,

pli-tv-kd9:4.6.7.eng: it’s invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:4.6.8.pli: Mānattacārikacatuttho ce, bhikkhave, parivāsaṃ dadeyya, mūlāya paṭikasseyya, mānattaṃ dadeyya, taṃvīso abbheyya—
pli-tv-kd9:4.6.8.eng: If a group with one undertaking the trial period as the fourth member gives probation, sends back to the beginning, or gives the trial period, or a group with one undertaking a trial period as the twentieth member rehabilitates,

pli-tv-kd9:4.6.9.eng: it’s invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:4.6.10.pli: Abbhānārahacatuttho ce, bhikkhave, parivāsaṃ dadeyya, mūlāya paṭikasseyya, mānattaṃ dadeyya, taṃvīso abbheyya—
pli-tv-kd9:4.6.10.eng: If a group with one deserving rehabilitation as the fourth member gives probation, sends back to the beginning, or gives the trial period, or a group with one deserving rehabilitation as the twentieth member rehabilitates,

pli-tv-kd9:4.6.11.eng: it’s invalid and not to be done.

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.1.pli: Ekaccassa, bhikkhave, saṅghamajjhe paṭikkosanā ruhati, ekaccassa na ruhati.
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.1.eng: In the midst of the Sangha, the objections of some are valid, not the objections of others.

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.2.pli: Kassa ca, bhikkhave, saṅghamajjhe paṭikkosanā na ruhati?
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.2.eng: Whose objections are invalid in the midst of the Sangha?

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.3.pli: Bhikkhuniyā, bhikkhave, saṅghamajjhe paṭikkosanā na ruhati.
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.3.eng: In the midst of the Sangha, the objection of a nun is invalid.

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.4.eng: In the midst of the Sangha, the objection of a trainee nun,

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.7.eng: of one who’s renounced the training,

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.8.eng: of one who’s committed the worst kind of offense,

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.11.eng: of one who’s overwhelmed by pain,

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.12.eng: of one who’s been ejected for not recognizing an offense,

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.13.eng: of one who’s been ejected for not making amends for an offense,

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.14.eng: of one who’s been ejected for not giving up a bad view,

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.17.eng: of one who’s previously left to join the monastics of another religion,

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.21.eng: of a murderer of a perfected one,

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.22.eng: of one who’s raped a nun,

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.23.eng: of one who’s caused a schism in the Sangha,

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.24.eng: of one who’s caused the Buddha to bleed,

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.26.eng: of one who belongs to a different Buddhist sect,

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.27.eng: of one who’s outside the monastery zone,

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.28.pli: iddhiyā vehāse ṭhitassa, bhikkhave, yassa saṅgho kammaṃ karoti, tassa ca, bhikkhave, saṅghamajjhe paṭikkosanā na ruhati.
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.28.eng: of one floating in the air by supernormal power,

pli-tv-kd9:4.7.29.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, saṅghamajjhe paṭikkosanā na ruhati.
pli-tv-kd9:4.7.29.eng: or of one who’s subject to the legal procedure is invalid.

pli-tv-kd9:4.8.1.pli: Kassa ca, bhikkhave, saṅghamajjhe paṭikkosanā ruhati?
pli-tv-kd9:4.8.1.eng: And whose objections are valid in the midst of the Sangha?

pli-tv-kd9:4.8.2.pli: Bhikkhussa, bhikkhave, pakatattassa samānasaṃvāsakassa samānasīmāya ṭhitassa antamaso ānantarikassāpi bhikkhuno viññāpentassa saṅghamajjhe paṭikkosanā ruhati.
pli-tv-kd9:4.8.2.eng: In the midst of the Sangha, the objection of a regular monk, who belongs to the same Buddhist sect and is staying within the same monastery zone, even if just declared to a monk sitting next to him, is valid.

pli-tv-kd9:4.9.0.eng: 6. Discussion of the two kinds of sending away, etc.

pli-tv-kd9:4.9.1.eng: “There are two kinds of sending away.

pli-tv-kd9:4.9.2.eng: If the Sangha sends away someone who doesn’t have the attributes needed to be sent away,

pli-tv-kd9:4.9.3.pli: Tañce saṅgho nissāreti, ekacco sunissārito, ekacco dunnissārito.
pli-tv-kd9:4.9.3.eng: the sending away may succeed or fail.

pli-tv-kd9:4.9.4.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, puggalo appatto nissāraṇaṃ, tañce saṅgho nissāreti—dunnissārito?

pli-tv-kd9:4.9.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu suddho hoti anāpattiko. Tañce saṅgho nissāreti—dunnissārito.
pli-tv-kd9:4.9.5.eng: It fails if the monk is pure, without offenses.

pli-tv-kd9:4.9.6.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, puggalo appatto nissāraṇaṃ, tañce saṅgho nissāreti—dunnissārito.

pli-tv-kd9:4.9.7.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, puggalo appatto nissāraṇaṃ, tañce saṅgho nissāreti—sunissārito?

pli-tv-kd9:4.9.8.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu bālo hoti abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno, gihisaṃsaṭṭho viharati ananulomikehi gihisaṃsaggehi, tañce saṅgho nissāreti—sunissārito.
pli-tv-kd9:4.9.8.eng: It succeeds if the monk is ignorant, incompetent, often committing offenses, lacking in boundaries, constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
pli-tv-kd9:4.9.8.comm: According to CPD, apparently quoting the commentary (“Bu”), anapadāna means “‘who is unable to discern (what is an offense)’, or ‘not setting a good example’.” It is not clear, however, why apadāna should be rendered as “discern”. Sp 3.407: Apadānaṁ vuccati paricchedo; āpattiparicchedavirahitoti attho, “Limit is called apadāna; the meaning is ‘without limit to offenses’.” Sp-ṭ 3.395: Natthi etassa apadānaṁ avakhaṇḍanaṁ āpattipariyantoti anapadāno, “Anapadāno: he has no apadāna, no cutting off, no limit with offenses.”

pli-tv-kd9:4.9.9.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, puggalo appatto nissāraṇaṃ, tañce saṅgho nissāreti—sunissārito.

pli-tv-kd9:4.10.1.eng: There are two kinds of admittance.

pli-tv-kd9:4.10.2.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, puggalo appatto osāraṇaṃ tañce saṅgho osāreti, ekacco sosārito, ekacco dosārito.
pli-tv-kd9:4.10.2.eng: If the Sangha admits someone who doesn’t have the attributes needed to be admitted, the admittance may succeed or fail.

pli-tv-kd9:4.10.3.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, puggalo appatto osāraṇaṃ, tañce saṅgho osāreti—dosārito?

pli-tv-kd9:4.10.4.pli: Paṇḍako, bhikkhave, appatto osāraṇaṃ, tañce saṅgho osāreti—dosārito.
pli-tv-kd9:4.10.4.eng: A paṇḍaka doesn’t have the attributes needed to be admitted, and if the Sangha admits him, his admittance fails.

pli-tv-kd9:4.10.5.pli: Theyyasaṃvāsako, bhikkhave, appatto osāraṇaṃ, tañce saṅgho osāreti—dosārito.

pli-tv-kd9:4.10.6.eng: one who’s previously left to join the monastics of another religion,

pli-tv-kd9:4.10.10.eng: a murderer of a perfected one,

pli-tv-kd9:4.10.12.eng: one who’s caused a schism in the Sangha,

pli-tv-kd9:4.10.13.eng: one who’s caused the Buddha to bleed,

pli-tv-kd9:4.10.14.pli: ubhatobyañjanako, bhikkhave, appatto, osāraṇaṃ, tañce saṅgho osāreti—dosārito.
pli-tv-kd9:4.10.14.eng: or a hermaphrodite doesn’t have the attributes needed to be admitted, and if the Sangha admits him, his admittance fails.

pli-tv-kd9:4.10.15.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, puggalo appatto osāraṇaṃ, tañce saṅgho osāreti—dosārito.

pli-tv-kd9:4.10.16.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, puggalā appattā osāraṇaṃ, te ce saṅgho osāreti—dosāritā.

pli-tv-kd9:4.11.1.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, puggalo appatto osāraṇaṃ, tañce saṅgho osāreti—sosārito?

pli-tv-kd9:4.11.2.pli: Hatthacchinno, bhikkhave, appatto osāraṇaṃ, tañce saṅgho osāreti, sosārito.
pli-tv-kd9:4.11.2.eng: One without a hand doesn’t have the attributes needed to be admitted, but if the Sangha admits him, his admittance succeeds.

pli-tv-kd9:4.11.4.eng: one without a hand and a foot,

pli-tv-kd9:4.11.7.eng: one without an ear and nose,

pli-tv-kd9:4.11.8.eng: one without a finger or toe,
pli-tv-kd9:4.11.8.comm: This single phrase combines two Pali terms, aṅgulicchinna and aḷacchinna. The latter refers to a thumb or a big toe, whereas the former refers to any of the remaining four fingers or toes.

pli-tv-kd9:4.11.11.comm: Phaṇahatthaka, literally, “one who has a hand like a snake’s hood”. Sp 3.119: Phaṇahatthakoti yassa vaggulipakkhakā viya aṅguliyo sambaddhā honti, “Phaṇahatthako: one whose fingers are connected like the wings of a bat.”

pli-tv-kd9:4.11.17.comm: Likhitaka, literally, “one who has been written about”. Sp 3.119: Atha kho yo koci corikaṁ vā aññaṁ vā garuṁ rājāparādhaṁ katvā palāto, rājā ca naṁ paṇṇe vā potthake vā “itthannāmo yattha dissati, tattha gahetvā māretabbo”ti vā “hatthapādānissa chinditabbānī”ti vā “ettakaṁ nāma daṇḍaṁ āharāpetabbo”ti vā likhāpeti, ayaṁ likhitako nāma, “When someone has run away after stealing or doing another serious offense against the king, and the king causes the writing about him on a leaf or in a book that ‘wherever so-and-so is seen, he should be seized and executed’ or ‘his hands and feet are to be cut off’ or ‘this penalty is to be imposed’, this a called a wanted criminal.”

pli-tv-kd9:4.11.20.comm: Parisadūsaka, literally, “one who defiles an assembly”. Sp 3.93: Parisadūsakoti yo attano virūpatāya parisaṁ dūseti; atidīgho vā hoti aññesaṁ sīsappamāṇanābhippadeso, atirasso vā …, “Parisadūsaka: whoever defiles an assembly through his own bad appearance. He is too tall, a head taller than others, or he is too short …”

pli-tv-kd9:4.11.24.comm: Sp 3.119: Pakkhahatoti yassa eko hattho vā pādo vā aḍḍhasarīraṁ vā sukhaṁ na vahati, “Pakkhahata: for whom one hand or one foot or half the body does not work properly.”

pli-tv-kd9:4.11.25.comm: Chinniriyāpatha, literally, “the ways of movement have been cut off”. Sp 3.119: Chinniriyāpathoti pīṭhasappi vuccati, “One who crawls is called chinniriyāpatha.” The exact meaning is not clear.

pli-tv-kd9:4.11.33.pli: andhamūgabadhiro, bhikkhave, appatto osāraṇaṃ, tañce saṅgho osāreti—sosārito.
pli-tv-kd9:4.11.33.eng: or one who’s blind and mute and deaf doesn’t have the attributes needed to be admitted, but if the Sangha admits him, his admittance succeeds.”

pli-tv-kd9:4.11.34.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, puggalo appatto osāraṇaṃ, tañce saṅgho osāreti—sosārito.

pli-tv-kd9:4.11.35.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, puggalā appattā osāraṇaṃ, te ce saṅgho osāreti—sosāritā.

pli-tv-kd9:4.11.36.eng: The first section for recitation on the village of Vāsabha is finished.

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.0.eng: 7. Discussion of illegitimate legal procedures, etc.

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.1.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa na hoti āpatti daṭṭhabbā.
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.1.1.eng: “It may be that a monk doesn’t have any offense he needs to recognize,

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.2.pli: Tamenaṃ codeti saṅgho vā sambahulā vā ekapuggalo vā—
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.2.eng: yet a Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.2.comm: “Several” renders sambahula. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.3.eng: ‘You’ve committed an offense. Do you recognize it?’

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.5.eng: ‘I haven’t committed any offense that I should recognize,’

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.6.eng: yet the Sangha ejects him for not recognizing an offense,

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.7.eng: then the legal procedure is illegitimate.

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.8.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa na hoti āpatti paṭikātabbā.
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.8.eng: It may be that a monk doesn’t have any offense he needs to make amends for,

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.9.pli: Tamenaṃ codeti saṅgho vā sambahulā vā ekapuggalo vā—
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.9.eng: yet a Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.10.pli: ‘āpattiṃ tvaṃ, āvuso, āpanno, paṭikarohi taṃ āpattin’ti.
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.10.eng: ‘You’ve committed an offense. Make amends for it.’

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.12.eng: ‘I haven’t committed any offense that I should make amends for,’

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.13.eng: yet the Sangha ejects him for not making amends for an offense,

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.14.eng: then the legal procedure is illegitimate.

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.15.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa na hoti pāpikā diṭṭhi paṭinissajjetā.
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.15.eng: It may be that a monk doesn’t have any bad view he needs to give up,

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.16.pli: Tamenaṃ codeti saṅgho vā sambahulā vā ekapuggalo vā—
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.16.eng: yet a Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.17.pli: ‘pāpikā te, āvuso, diṭṭhi, paṭinissajjetaṃ pāpikaṃ diṭṭhin’ti.
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.17.eng: ‘You have a bad view that you need to give up.’

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.19.pli: ‘natthi me, āvuso, pāpikā diṭṭhi, yamahaṃ paṭinissajjeyyan’ti.
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.19.eng: ‘I don’t have any bad view that I should give up,’

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.20.pli: Taṃ saṅgho pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhipati—
pli-tv-kd9:5.1.20.eng: yet the Sangha ejects him for not giving up a bad view,

pli-tv-kd9:5.1.21.eng: then the legal procedure is illegitimate.

pli-tv-kd9:5.2.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa na hoti āpatti daṭṭhabbā, na hoti āpatti paṭikātabbā.
pli-tv-kd9:5.2.1.eng: It may be that a monk doesn’t have any offense he needs to recognize, nor any he needs to make amends for,

pli-tv-kd9:5.2.2.pli: Tamenaṃ codeti saṅgho vā sambahulā vā ekapuggalo vā—
pli-tv-kd9:5.2.2.eng: yet a Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:

pli-tv-kd9:5.2.3.eng: ‘You’ve committed an offense. Do you recognize it?

pli-tv-kd9:5.2.6.eng: ‘I haven’t committed any offense that I should recognize,

pli-tv-kd9:5.2.7.pli: Natthi me, āvuso, āpatti, yamahaṃ paṭikareyyan’ti.

pli-tv-kd9:7.12.0.eng: 16. Discussion of the lifting of the legal procedure of condemnation

pli-tv-kd9:7.12.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saṅghena tajjanīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, tajjanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd9:7.12.1.eng: “It may be, monks, that the Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against a monk, that he then conducts himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and that he then asks for the lifting of that procedure.
pli-tv-kd9:7.12.1.comm: The meaning of the first of these phrases, sammā vattati, is straightforward, but the last two, lomaṁ pāteti and netthāraṁ vattati, are more difficult. Commenting on Bu Ss 13, Sp 1.435 says: Na lomaṁ pātentīti anulomapaṭipadaṁ appaṭipajjanatāya na pannalomā honti. Na netthāraṁ vattantīti attano nittharaṇamaggaṁ na paṭipajjanti, “Na lomaṁ pātenti: because of their non-practicing in conformity with the path, their bodily hairs are not flat. Na netthāraṁ vattanti: they are not practicing the path for their own getting out (of the offense).” My rendering attempts to capture the meaning in a non-literal way.
